name: places/ChIJGx5E3-JYwokRgS3g8GvfnDU
formattedAddress: 600 Madison Ave Suite 2001, New York, NY 10022, USA
adrFormatAddress: 600 Madison Ave Suite 2001, New York, NY 10022, USA

originalText.text:
They manage the property I rented in MD, Lambeth House. I had a major issue with the property manager Joann. When I was moving out they did not care that she did not follow the law. Maybe it is by their direction. I contacted them via certified mail regarding the issue and never heard back.

Once you move out it is hard to communicate with the PM or headquarters.

Long story short, I am having to go to small claims court since she did not provide me with the documents I am legally able to have regarding the repair of the carpet that she said had to be replaced. I believe they claim to do certain things within the apartment but don't actually do them at all or drastically overcharge you and do not send proof of the actual cost. All I asked was for the supporting documents, and she would just ignore me for weeks and then declined.

It is really sad honestly, how they just fully disregard the law when you move out.

originalText.text:
I rented with them in Manhattan and the communication was unprofessional, rude and harassing. Esther Goldrich has screamed at me on the phone when I wanted to renew my lease and the there was a sudden rent increase which I was never informed about in advance. I will not go forward with them because of the unprofessionalism. This is my last month with them. They want to show my apt to a new person whenever they feel like. I have clearly told them I work from home and cannot be disturbed and gave them August 1st, whole day to show apt. Nobody shows up. They text me to show the next day and I say it doesn’t work and can do the day after work at 5 pm.  I get a voicemail trying to force me to give my keys. I don’t have a problem to show the apt, but shouldn’t that work with my schedule?

I asked for landlord reference letter for my rents application, haven’t received anything when I was emailed, they will send it. I hope nobody has to go through this. Do better, learn to treat people right.

originalText.text: They are trying to evict their tenants during the virus they are being very rude about it. some people paid their rent and was told it wasn't received! Check your books carefully before you do that because it turns out an era was made several times! Not a bad place to live in the summer time tenants are nice and friendly!   Update! Update! Kenilworth came through for me! I want to thank Dina Bean for working with me! Thanks Dina! Five stars for kenilworth!
